name: Interviewer
line: On whether he takes his success for granted.

name: Cuban
line: Every day, I look in the mirror and I just make sure I don't pinch myself so I don't wake up.

name: Interviewer
line: On his success after selling tech company MicroSolutions.

name: Cuban
line: I literally retired at 29 with a lifetime pass on American Airlines, and my goal was to party with as many people as possible.

name: Interviewer
line: On becoming an entrepreneur after getting fired from two jobs.

name: Cuban
line: Those back-to-back experiences confirmed what I already knew, that I was a (bad) employee.

name: Interviewer
line: On the fact that his purchase of a G5 airplane was the largest known online purchase.

name: Cuban
line: It was $41 million for an airplane. I can tell you without hesitation, it is really good to be able to do that.

name: Interviewer
line: On owning the Mavericks.

name: Cuban
line: Everybody thinks that we are in the basketball business. It's an NBA game; we're not in the basketball business. We're in the business of creating unique experiences.

name: Interviewer
line: On his relationship with former NBA Commissioner David Stern.

name: Cuban
line: We get along great. And the few things we didn't agree on, he had the authority to fine me on.

name: Interviewer
line: On whether or not he will vote to oust Clippers owner Donald Sterling.

name: Cuban
line: You'll find out. I know how I'm going to vote, but I'm not ready to comment on it.

name: Interviewer
line: On how to keep bigotry out of the NBA.

name: Cuban
line: You don't. There's no law against stupid.

name: Interviewer
line: On stupidity in general.

name: Cuban
line: I'm the one guy who says don't force the stupid people to be quiet, I want to know who the morons are.

name: Interviewer
line: On bigotry in general.

name: Cuban
line: I know I'm prejudiced and I know I'm bigoted in a lot of different ways. If I see a black kid in a hoodie on my side of the street, I'll move to the other side of the street. If I see a white guy with a shaved head and tattoos, I'll move back to the other side of the street. None of us have pure thoughts; we all live in glass houses.

name: Interviewer
line: On how to fix the national economy.

name: Cuban
line: Until you fix the student loan bubble, we don't have a chance. Everything else is shifting lawn chairs on the deck of the Titanic.

name: Interviewer
line: On the TV show Shark Tank.

name: Cuban
line: Shark Tank sends a message to everybody that the American dream is alive.

name: Interviewer
line: On the companies he's funded on Shark Tank.

name: Cuban
line: They're all my babies.

name: Interviewer
line: On why he still works.

name: Cuban
line: I love to compete. Somebody out there is competing with me and I want to kick your.
